alert.note: Alert for Providence (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 6:47PM EST until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northern Connecticut, including the following counties, Hartford, Tolland and Windham and northern Rhode Island, including the following county, Providence. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 647 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Manchester, East Hartford, Enfield, Glastonbury, Vernon, Wethersfield, Mansfield, South Windsor, Windham, Plainfield, Rocky Hill, Willimantic, Killingly, Burrillville, Ellington, Tolland, Coventry, Stafford, Somers and East Windsor. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
